markdownRemark.html:
I am vehemently anti-meetings. When I ran my teams with the Air Force, I did my best to limit the intrusions on my team members time with meetings. If I held a meeting, people knew it was for something important. Early on in my career I had seen my fair share of terrible meetings that should have been an email. Or ones intended to provide quick project updates that quickly devolved into someone venting about their projects.

I recently read a book, The Art of Gathering by Priya Parker, which was a very powerful, thought provoking book.

frontmatter.title: Gathering Effectively
frontmatter.description: How many organizations waste time with pointless meetings? Why don't we fight back against them, not by killing the meeting, but by taking more ownership of them?
